Header: Italians Gruber and Lanthaler clinch luge World Championships
Content: Italy’s Alex Gruber and Evelin Lanthaler clinched the men’s and women’s respective titles at the Natural Luge World Championship in Latzfons. Austrian Michael Sheikl was a surprise bronze in the men’s event, just behind compatriot Thomas Kammerlander, who finished second. Gruber, a native of South Tyrol, the northern Italian region where the event was being held, grabbed gold with a consistent performance throughout the championship. Lanthaler is another South Tyrolean winning in front of home crowd, beating former champion Greta Pinggera into second, with Austria’s Tina Unterberger in third.
